title: 'Fearless' Raducanu excited to play Rogers on Arthur Ashe Stadium
description: British teenager Emma Raducanu is unfazed by the prospect of playing home favourite Shelby Rogers on Arthur Ashe Stadium in the US Open last 16.

title: Joe Ferrari: The high-rolling life of Thailand's controversial ex-police chief
description: Joe Ferrari, who is said to own 42 cars, was last month pictured torturing a suspect to death.

title: Feria: Rural memoirs stir longing for Spain's past
description: Ana Iris Simón's autobiographical book triggers a frenzied debate about the loss of village life.

title: Khalid Sheikh Mohammed: How '9/11 mastermind' slipped through FBI's fingers
description: Could the man accused of hatching the plot to fly planes into US landmarks 20 years ago have been stopped?

title: Solheim Cup 2021: Best shots from day two as Europe take lead into singles
description: Watch some of the best shots of a tense second day of the Solheim Cup as the US narrow Europe's lead going in to Monday's singles.

title: South Africa danger zone: Living in a 'hijacked' building
description: Pictures of squatters in a South African inner city with high levels of crime, drugs and prostitution.

title: US Senator Lindsey Graham: 'We will be going back into Afghanistan'
description: Republican Senator Lindsey Graham believes there will be no choice as "the threat will be so large".

title: Students return with school restrictions lifted
description: Students across the UK are returning to school after the summer break and and a year disrupted by Covid.

title: Saving Australian frog species on the brink of extinction
description: Scientists fear four species are already extinct but say urgent action can save others.

title: Has Covid killed off business cards for good?
description: Sales of business cards have fallen sharply as a result of the pandemic.

title: Black interns: 'You just need to give us a chance'
description: Young black university students are being invited to apply for 2,000 internships at top companies.

title: WSL Highlights: Arsenal shock defending champions Chelsea
description: Watch highlights as a brace from Beth Mead and another from Vivianne Miedema help Arsenal to a 3-2 win over defending WSL champions Chelsea.

title: Afghanistan: Rural areas welcome peace and end of war
description: In more rural areas of Afghanistan, people welcome the end of a war that has killed tens of thousands.

title: Afghanistan: Taliban accused of killing pregnant police officer
description: The killing comes amid increasing reports of escalating repression of women in Afghanistan.

title: Tanni Grey-Thompson column: 'Great moments in Tokyo but Para-sport faces challenges'
description: Baroness Tanni Grey-Thompson reflects on Great Britain's performance at the Tokyo Paralympics and what comes next for Para-sport.

title: Covid-19: Vaccine passports to start in England this month
description: The scheme for nightclubs and other venues from the end of September aims to ensure they stay open.

title: England v India: Virat Kohli out for 44 edging Moeen Ali to slip
description: Virat Kohli edges Moeen Ali to Craig Overton at slip for 44, as India fall to 312-6 with a lead of 213 over England in the second innings of the fourth Test at The Oval.

title: Social care: Plans for reform in England likely this week - sources
description: Government talks are continuing through the weekend, following reports of a National Insurance hike.

title: Moment boy cuts ribbon too soon at opening ceremony in Turkey

title: NHS child gender identity clinic whistleblower wins tribunal
description: An employment tribunal rules in favour of a staff member who says bosses treated her unfavourably.

title: Covid-19: Pub marquees could become permanent fixtures

title: Afghanistan: 'Everyone got it wrong' on Taliban takeover - armed forces chief
description: Gen Sir Nick Carter says the speed of the Taliban's takeover of Afghanistan surprised the UK.

title: Tokyo Paralympics: Great Britain finish Games with two more bronze medals
description: Great Britain win two bronze medals on the final day of the Tokyo Paralympics to finish second in the medal table.

title: Montenegro clashes as Serb Orthodox Church leader installed
description: The fierce protests reflect tensions in the country, which broke away from Serbia in 2006.

title: Michael Fawcett: Charles' former aide steps down over honour claims
description: Michael Fawcett has been accused of offering to help a wealthy Saudi businessman receive a CBE.

description: Great Britain's Paralympics team has "rewritten the history books" with their performance in Tokyo, says chef de mission Penny Briscoe.

description: The women say the Taliban used tear gas and pepper spray to disperse the latest such protest.

title: The Papers: 'Tories at war', and Charles aide honour claims
